result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Piskula was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to maintain fulltime employment/school or combination of the two, if not fully engaged complete 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with Wausau East Hight School.

Assessment, counseling, and treatment as deemed appropriate by agent.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Piskula

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Case called: 11:58am
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant appears in person and with Atty Julie Sawyer

Parties state agreement - $1125 to be paid to Wausau East of at least $150/month, with any payments made to be directed through DOC.

COURT grants stipulation and signs order.

Adj: 12:00pm
and Certificate of Appearance (subpoena mailed to R.Z. 5/12/16)
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Charli
Case Called: 3:45 p.m.
State appears by ADA Chad Minder.  Def appears in person with Atty Austin Mort.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

ADA Minder notes Restitution is NOT agreed upon by parties; Atty Mort in agreement.

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (Criminal Damage to Property)>> No Contest

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: S/H 1 year probation; CONDITIONS: Assessment/Counseling/Treatment as deemed appropriate by Agent; No Contact with Wausau East High School; Maintain fulltime employment/school or combination of the 2, if not fully engaged, GFE to obtain status AND 10 hrs of CS per week; Restitution in amount TBT; DNA Sample & Surcharge; CC.
COURT notes Deft is released from bond.

JA to contact PD's Office to set Contested Restitution Hearing after 05/20/2016.
CC on 04/28/2016 with ADA Minder to set Hearing date.

Adj:  3:53 a.m.
and Certificate of Appearance (subpoena mailed to Wausau East High School Attn:  R.Z. 4/15/16)
Plea hearing on April 26, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
State's Notice Regarding Defendant's Statements - Br 4 has a copy

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:26am
State appears by ADA C.Minder. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Austin Mort.


Parties note agreement has NOT been reached in this matter.
COURT questions parties as to discovery and if any motions will be filed before trial; Parties state no issues on discovery and no further issues court will need to decide.

COURT leaves FPT/JT dates on court's calendar
Bond continues.

Adj: 8:27am
Dft wants atty; went to PD office; PTC reset

Pre-trial conference at 02-23-2016 09:45 am.
Plea hearing at 03-18-2016 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial at 04-14-2016 09:00 am.
Jury Trial at 05-03-2016 08:15 am.

No contact with victim(s):  Wausau East H.S. property.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
